bug.short_desc: VerifyError "Inconsistent stackmap frames" for switch nested within try-catch

long_desc.thetext: Will take a look. Very late for 3.8. Tagging for 3.8.1.
(Assuming this is handwritten code) A workaround is to initialize rc.

We have:
// Method descriptor #6 ()V // Stack: 2, Locals: 2 public void method(); 0 iconst_0 1 tableswitch default: 58 case 0: 28 case 1: 38 case 2: 48 28 iconst_0 29 istore_1 [rc] 30 aload_0 [this] 31 iload_1 [rc] 32 invokespecial X.setRC(int) : void [33] 35 goto 62 38 iconst_1 39 istore_1 [rc] 40 aload_0 [this] 41 iconst_0 42 invokespecial X.setRC(int) : void [33] 45 goto 62 48 iconst_2 49 istore_1 [rc] 50 aload_0 [this] 51 iconst_0 52 invokespecial X.setRC(int) : void [33] 55 goto 62 58 goto 62 61 astore_1 62 return Exception Table: [pc: 0, pc: 58] -> 61 when : java.lang.Exception Line numbers: [pc: 0, line: 10] [pc: 28, line: 13] [pc: 30, line: 14] [pc: 35, line: 15] [pc: 38, line: 17] [pc: 40, line: 18] [pc: 45, line: 19] [pc: 48, line: 21] [pc: 50, line: 23] [pc: 55, line: 24] [pc: 58, line: 26] [pc: 61, line: 29] [pc: 62, line: 31] Local variable table: [pc: 0, pc: 63] local: this index: 0 type: X [pc: 30, pc: 38] local: rc index: 1 type: int [pc: 40, pc: 48] local: rc index: 1 type: int [pc: 50, pc: 61] local: rc index: 1 type: int Stack map table: number of frames 6 [pc: 28, same] [pc: 38, same] [pc: 48, same] [pc: 58, append: {int}] [pc: 61, full, stack: {java.lang.Exception}, locals: {X}] [pc: 62, same]
Similar symptoms. The last range for the local rc is wrong. It should not include the second goto 62.
I'll investigate.
If the default is not empty, then the code generation is good. Must be something trivial.

The problem is inside the code generation itself. Data flow analysis is fine in this case. There is some code to extend to last entry pc inside the try statement in order to cover the natural exit goto. This code should only touch the line number attribute, not the locals. I am working on a fix and will test it before submitting a patch as this goes into 3.8.1 anyway, there is no rush.
Another observation: the switch has to be the last statement inside the try and the empty default has to be the last case in the switch for the problem to show up.

Created attachment 217125 Patch from Olivier
- Thanks a lot for the patch Olivier !
Created attachment 217126 Modified tests
Created attachment 217127 Modified tests - Part - II
*** Bug 383629 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I'll take care of releasing and backporting this one

Created attachment 218042 Modified tests part II updated
Released in master via commit 46bdd6036153580a7889ceb7993a8f8a6300be85

Ayush, please release for 3.8.1, TIA.
Jay, this need to go into 3.8.1 RC1. Ayush, please release ASAP. TIA,
Can someone please verify this for 4.3M1 meanwhile?

Verified for 4.3 M1 using Build id: I20120807-2000.
The query used is looking for resolved defects only. We need to be careful to avoid missing out some entries that need to be tested.
Released in 3.8 maintenance via http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?h=R3_8_maintenance&id=041912ceb9a5f521c813af54b6d48dec70205597
Verified for 3.8.1 using Build id: M20120815-1000

Problem also exists in 4.2.1.
Could fix for this be considered to backport to 4.2.2?

(In reply to comment #22) > Problem also exists in 4.2.1. > > Could fix for this be considered to backport to 4.2.2?
The fix was also released for 4.2.1. I am surprised you could reproduce with 4.2.1. Perhaps it's a difference scenario?

(In reply to comment #23) > (In reply to comment #22) > > Problem also exists in 4.2.1. > > > > Could fix for this be considered to backport to 4.2.2? > > The fix was also released for 4.2.1. I am surprised you could reproduce with > 4.2.1. Perhaps it's a difference scenario?
Bug 394718 is one such candidate that got fixed just recently.
Jeff, could you try if the problem also exists with this build: http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops4/M20121128-1200/

Still exists in M20121128-1200.
This may be a new condition. I will try to find a product-agnostic way to reproduce & open a new defect.

(In reply to comment #25) > Still exists in M20121128-1200. > > This may be a new condition. I will try to find a product-agnostic way to > reproduce & open a new defect. Any news on this? If this defect still exists, it should be investigated asap, otherwise we will miss the 4.2.2 release.
Created attachment 224751 testcase causes VerifyError using IES 3.6j7 JDT

(In reply to comment #27) > Created attachment 224751 [details] > testcase causes VerifyError using IES 3.6j7 JDT
I'm not sure what's IES, but I can't reproduce the bug in 4.2.1. Seeing the bug in 3.6j7 is expected.

(In reply to comment #26) > (In reply to comment #25) > > Still exists in M20121128-1200. > > > > This may be a new condition. I will try to find a product-agnostic way to > > reproduce & open a new defect. > Any news on this? If this defect still exists, it should be investigated > asap, otherwise we will miss the 4.2.2 release.
Everything is fine in 4.2.x. What's really strange is that I can also reproduce the error (comment 27) directly on R3.6.2 but not when I load that JDT Core source into my workspace and start a target workspace from there: there verify error does not appear.

(In reply to comment #28) > (In reply to comment #27) > > Created attachment 224751 [details] > > testcase causes VerifyError using IES 3.6j7 JDT > > I'm not sure what's IES,
This is the IBM Eclipse SDK. Basically, it assembles different Eclipse projects like JDT or WTP in one package.
> but I can't reproduce the bug in 4.2.1. > Seeing the bug in 3.6j7 is expected.
Correct. We simply have to backport the missing VerifyError fixes to 'R3_6_maintenance_Java7'. Filed bug 396723 to track this.
(In reply to comment #29) > What's really strange is that I can also > reproduce the error (comment 27) directly on R3.6.2 but not when I load that > JDT Core source into my workspace and start a target workspace from there: > there verify error does not appear.
Ignore this comment. I forgot to also take JDT UI and Debug from source and hence it silently used 1.6 compliance.
can someone please update 3.7.2 with the solution ?

(In reply to koby palachi from comment #31) > can someone please update 3.7.2 with the solution ?
Not sure what you mean. 3.7.x is done. There are no further builds for that.
